titleStmt.title: Philip Tomppert et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7356

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisville Novr 14th 1865
Hon Thos E Bramlette
Govr of Ky.
Sir.

Your petitioner Jacob Hyler would respectfully represent that at the November Term of the Louisville City Court he was fined fifty dollars for an assault & battery committed on Ambrose Snyder. He would respectfully state that he is a poor man and unable to pay the fine imposed -- Circumstances surrounding the case ought he thinks to appeal to you for the exercise of your clemency
We respectfully join in the prayer of the petitioners.

Philip Tomppert Mayor
A Gilmore Chef of Police
Phil Tomppert Jr C. C. C. L.
James P Harbeson City Judge
H F Vissman
Hays & Cooper
I thought, that $25 -- fine against Mr Ayler would have been Enough

Louisvile City Ct
vs
Jacob Hyler
$50,
Remit
$25 fine
Assault & Battery
23rd Nov/65
